title: 111_hr5208
content: The "Student Visa Security Improvement Act" is the short title of the Act. It includes provisions for enhanced background checks for student visas. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to require in-person interviews for student visa applicants recommended by the Department of State, focusing on determining admissibility. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to require in-person interviews for student visa applicants recommended by the Department of State to ensure admissibility under section 212(a)(3)(B) related to terrorist activities. Employees must conduct on-site reviews of visa applications before final adjudication and update the memorandum of understanding between the Department of Homeland Security and the Department of State. Employees assigned under paragraph (1) must clarify their roles and responsibilities regarding duties outlined in this paragraph. SEC. 3. STUDENT AND EXCHANGE VISITOR PROGRAM. The Student Visa Security Improvement Act amends the Homeland Security Act of 2002 to require regulations for institutions participating in the Student and Exchange Visitor Program to ensure the security of enrolled students and exchange visitors. The Student Visa Security Improvement Act mandates regulations for institutions in the Student and Exchange Visitor Program to monitor participants' active status, attendance, and timely reporting of transfers. The Student Visa Security Improvement Act requires institutions in the Student and Exchange Visitor Program to monitor participants' status, attendance, and information updates in the SEVIS system. Covered students must be observed at least once every 60 days, and appropriate employees are granted access to the SEVIS system. The Student Visa Security Improvement Act mandates institutions in the Student and Exchange Visitor Program to have authorized users for monitoring participants in the SEVIS system. Each institution must have at least two authorized users, with additional users required based on the number of covered students or exchange visitors enrolled. Authorized users must be certified after completing a training course provided by the Department. The Secretary will offer technical support options to facilitate system use. The Secretary will update the program to include new data fields for covered students' academic performance and timely information entry. Nothing in this section shall prohibit the Secretary or institutions from providing technical support options for system use. The new section prohibits requiring more frequent observations of covered students in the Student Exchange Visitor Program. It also provides definitions for "covered student," "observed," and "authorized user." The Comptroller General will review fees for the Student and Exchange Visitor Program of the Department of Homeland Security from fiscal years 2007 through 2010, considering all associated expenses. Authorization of appropriations for fiscal year 2011 to carry out sections 2 and 3 of this Act and related amendments.
